moves.1... d5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bf4 Nf6 4. e3 Nh5: So, decision time, I can put the bishop to g5 hoping to draw h6 and later g5 but I opt to develop my knight and live with the double pawns
moves.5. Nbd2 Nxf4 6. exf4 Qd6 7. Bb5: White offers the pawn and black greedily takes it
moves.7... Qxf4 8. Ne5 Bd7 9. Nxd7 Kxd7 10. Nf: despite being a pawn down White doesn't stand too bad
moves.10... a6 11. Ne5+: It is looking messy for black.
moves.11... Ke8 12. Bxc6+ bxc6 13. O-O: White puts the king aways safely the kight on e5 is really happy and  black  has few options
moves.17... Qd7 18. dxc5: White has gone from a pawn down to two pawns up, and black is struggling for moves
moves.18... Ra8 19. Rae1 h5: Black tries to get something going
moves.22... e6 23. f5 Kd7: It is all over for black
moves.24. fxe6+ fxe6 25. Rf7+: White has so much space and the pieces are working well together
